items.title: Why Oil Prices are Set to Fall Below $60 Next Year
items.summary: Oil prices are set to average below $60 per barrel next year, investment banks have said in their latest forecasts in recent weeks.  In 2026, both Brent Crude and WTI Crude are expected to slip from current levels of $63 per barrel and $60 a barrel,

items.title: Carbon Tax Puts EU at Odds With Export Majors
items.summary: On January 1 next year, a new tax will come into effect in the European Union. Dubbed the carbon border adjustment mechanism, the tax will be imposed on imports from non-EU countries with less strict emission reduction standards. Those countries are

items.title: No Breakthrough on Donbas as Zelenskyy Meets With European Allies

items.title: Labor Shortages Threaten to Derail Europe's Energy Security Pivot
items.summary: The European Union has drawn a line in the sand. By 2027, the bloc intends to phase out Russian natural gas imports completely.  But as the policy ink dries in Brussels, a new challenge is emerging in the real economy… We might not have enough hands

items.title: National Gas Prices Fall Again To Multi-Year Lows
items.summary: The national average price of gasoline has continued on a downward trend after dropping below $3 a gallon a week ago, sinking to their lowest level since 2021. The median U.S. gas price is now $2.79 per gallon, with the national average 4 cents lower

items.title: Tesla Shares Slip After Morgan Stanley Downgrade
items.summary: Tesla shares slipped more than 4% on Monday after Morgan Stanley cut its rating on the stock to Equal-weight from Overweight, even as the firm raised its price target to $425 from $410. With Tesla changing hands around $455 into the move, the new tar

items.title: Kazakhstan To Supply Crude Directly To China After CPC Pipeline Damage
items.summary: Kazakhstan will supply 50,000 metric tons of crude to China directly from the Kashagan oilfield in December after a Ukrainian drone damaged the Caspian Pipeline Consortium (CPC) at the Black Sea terminal, Reuters reported on Monday. The Caspian Pipel

items.title: Europe Fast-Tracks Industrial Electrification With €1B Auction

items.title: A Supply Crisis is Looming for Metals With No Dedicated Mines
